thread.title: This is what 100 pounds of nachos look like
thread.title_full: This is what 100 pounds of nachos look like

author: Liz Biro
title: This is what 100 pounds of nachos look like
text:
This is what 100 pounds of nachos look like Liz Biro , liz.biro@indystar.com Published 5:16 p.m. CT Feb. 2, 2017 | Updated 6 hours ago The crunchy, cheesy, meaty Super Bowl 51 mountain is on display in Carmel The 100-pound nachos mound for Super Bowl 51 at Market District. (Photo: Market District Carmel) 107 CONNECT 1 COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
Forget the game. Take me to the nachos – all 100 pounds of them. 
Nachos rank No. 4 in the top 10 Super Bowl foods people want to eat, right behind No. 1 pizza, No. 2 chili and No. 3 wings, according to The Daily Meal ’s review of Google trends over the past month. 
The 100-pound nachos mountain on display this week at Market District in Carmel is a 4-foot-high crunchy, cheesy, meaty heap. It requires 30 pounds of tortilla chips, 40 pounds of shredded chicken and ground beef and about 10 pounds of beans. 
Fifteen pounds of queso cheese gets poured over the whole thing. 
And then there’s the garnishes: 2 pounds each of onions, olives, jalapeños, lettuce, tomato, sliced radishes, sour cream, guacamole and pico de gallo top. 
The whole pile costs $200, but you have to build it yourself, and that takes about three hours and the entire dining room table. 
Call IndyStar reporter Liz Biro at (317) 444-6264. Follow her on Twitter: @lizbiro , Instagram: @lizbiro , Facebook and Pinterest .
